intro: Crataegus alachuana, commonly known as the Florida hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 3 to 10 meters and is characterized by its thorny branches and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces white to pink flowers in the spring, followed by red or orange berries in the fall. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, providing food for various wildlife species.
